intro: Stemonoporus scaphifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stemonoporus, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, evergreen shrub characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often curved at the tips. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are usually arranged in opposite pairs and have a leathery texture. Stemonoporus scaphifolius is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
